Property.Name: ApplicationName

Text.ValueDesc: The name of the application that created this file or item.

Property.Text: Do not use version numbers to identify the application's specific version.

Text.ValueDesc: The author or authors of the document.
The comment attached to a file, typically added by a user.

Text.Summary: Gets the keywords for the item
Text.ValueDesc: The set of keywords (also known as "tags") assigned to the item.

Property.Name: Subject

Text.ValueDesc: The subject of a document.

Property.Text: This property maps to the OLE document property Subject.

Text.Summary: Gets the Title of the item.
Text.ValueDesc: The title of the item.

Property.Name: Category

Text.ValueDesc: The category that can be assigned to an item such as a document or file.

Property.Text: Deprecated.

Text.ValueDesc: The company or publisher.
The content type
The copyright information stored as a string.
The parental rating stored in a format typically determined by the organization named in System.

Property.Name: Rating

Text.Summary: Indicates the users preference rating of an item on a scale of 1-99
Text.ValueDesc: 1-12 = One Star, 13-37 = Two Stars, 38-62 = Three Stars, 63-87 = Four Stars, 88-99 = Five Stars.

Property.Text: This is the rating system used by the Windows Vista Shell.

Property.Name: ItemAuthors

Text.Summary: This is the generic list of authors associated with an item.
Text.ValueDesc: Generic list of authors associated with an item.

Property.Text: For example, the artist name for a music track is the item author.

Property.Name: ItemType

Text.ValueDesc: The canonical type of the item, intended to be programmatically parsed.

Property.Text: If there is no canonical type, the value is VT_EMPTY. If the item is a file (ie, System.FileName is not VT_EMPTY), the value is the same as System.FileExtension. Use System.ItemTypeText when you want to display the type to end users in a view. (If the item is a file, passing the System.ItemType value to PSFormatForDisplay will result in the same value as System.ItemTypeText.)

Property.Name: ItemTypeText

Text.ValueDesc: This is the user friendly type name of the item.

Property.Text: This is not intended to be programmatically parsed. If System.ItemType is VT_EMPTY, the value of this property is also VT_EMPTY. If the item is a file, the value of this property is the same as if you passed the file's System.ItemType value to PSFormatForDisplay. This property should not be confused with System.Kind, where System.Kind is a high-level user friendly kind name.

Property.Name: Kind

Text.ValueDesc: System.Kind values that are used to map extensions to various Search folders.

Property.Text: Extensions are mapped to Kinds at HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\KindMap The list of kinds is not extensible.

Property.Name: MIMEType

Text.ValueDesc: The MIME type.

Property.Text: Eg, for EML files: 'message/rfc822'.

Text.ValueDesc: Explains file ratings.

Property.Name: ParentalRatingsOrganization

Text.ValueDesc: The name of the organization whose rating system is used for System.

Property.Text: ParentalRating.

Text.ValueDesc: The Sensitivity value.

Property.Name: SensitivityText

Text.ValueDesc: The user-friendly form of System.Sensitivity.

Property.Text: This value is not intended to be parsed programmatically.

Text.Summary: Indicates the users preference rating of an item on a scale of 0-5
Text.ValueDesc: 0=unrated, 1=One Star, 2=Two Stars, 3=Three Stars, 4=Four Stars, 5=Five Stars
The trademark associated with the item, in a string format.
A hash value that indicates the acquisition session.

Property.Name: AppZoneIdentifier

Text.Summary: Gets the Mark of the app container.
Text.ValueDesc: Mark of the app container.

Property.Text: The zone identifier as determined by the file's last writer.

Text.ValueDesc: Gets the application-defined properties

Text.DisplayName: Cached File Updater Content Id For Conflict Resolution
Text.ValueDesc: Gets the Cached File Updater Content Id For Conflict Resolution

Text.DisplayName: Cached File Updater Content Id For Stream
Text.ValueDesc: Gets the Cached File Updater Content Id For Stream

Text.Summary: Gets the Camera Roll Deduplication Id.

Text.ValueDesc: The amount of total storage space, expressed in bytes.
The name of the computer where the item or file is located.
A list of the type of content in the item.
The AppId of the application that created this file.

Text.Summary: Gets the Creator Open With UIOptions.
Text.ValueDesc: Provides options that influence the behavior of UI controls that launch the file with the app specified in System.CreatorAppId.
The data object format. A string value that is the clipboard format name.

Property.Name: DateAccessed

Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the last time the item was accessed.

Property.Text: The Indexing Service friendly name is "access".

Text.ValueDesc: The acquisition date of the file or media.
The date the file item was last archived.
The date and time the item was created on the file system where it is currently located.
The date and time the file was imported into a private application database.

Property.Name: DateModified

Text.Summary: The date and time of the last modification to the item.
Text.ValueDesc: The date and time of the last modification to the item.

Property.Text: The Indexing Service friendly name is 'write'.

Text.Summary: Gets the Default Save Location Display.
Text.ValueDesc: Helps display as an icon whether or not a location is the default save location for owner and/or non-owners of a library.

Text.Summary: Gets the Default Save Location Icon Container.

Text.ValueDesc: The contents of an SHDESCRIPTIONID structure, represented as a buffer of bytes.
Properties that are not stored in the item itself, where the properties are in the form of a stream containing a SERIALIZEDPROPSTORAGE.
The attributes of the item. These are equivalent to the values recognized in the dwFileAttributes member of the WIN32_FIND_DATA structure.
The attributes of the item. These are equivalent to the values recognized in the dwFileAttributes member of the WIN32_FIND_DATA structure.
A user-friendly description of the file.
Identifies the file extension of the file-based item, including the leading period.
The unique file ID, also known as the File Reference Number.
The unique file ID, also known as the File Reference Number.
The file name, including its extension.

Property.Name: FileOfflineAvailabilityStatus

Text.ValueDesc: Null indicates the normal case (file is available offline).

Property.Text: The partial case is only for folders where some content may be available offline and some may not.

Text.ValueDesc: The owner of the file, as known by the file system.
Contains the placeholder file's status flags.

Text.Summary: Gets the File Reparse Point Tag.
Text.ValueDesc: Contains the placeholder file's status flags.

Property.Name: FilterInfo
Property.Win32: Used by: System.ThumbnailStream on .mp3 format file, System.Contact.AccountPictureLarge, System.Contact.AccountPictureSmall

Property.Name: FindData

Text.Summary: The WIN32_FIND_DATA structure as a buffer of bytes.
Text.ValueDesc: Contains the WIN32_FIND_DATA structure as a buffer of bytes.

Property.Text: Do not use this property for any other purpose.

Text.ValueDesc: The user-friendly form of System.FlagColor. This value is not intended to be parsed programmatically.
The status of a flag. Values: (0=none 1=white 2=Red).
The user-friendly form of System.FlagStatus. This value is not intended to be parsed programmatically.

This property represents the types of content stored in this folder specified by the storage provider.Each folder type must be one of the known value specified by System.Kind definitionSystem.FolderKind is a readonly property, it should only be updated by the storage provider.
This property is similar to System.ItemNameDisplay except it is only set for folders, for files it will be empty.
The amount of free space in a volume, in bytes.

This property is used to specify search terms that should be applied as broadly as possible across all valid properties for the data source(s) being searched. It should not be emitted from a data source.

Text.Summary: Gets the Has No Additional Properties.
Gets the Hide In Grep Search.

Text.ValueDesc: The high confidence keywords for the item.

Text.Summary: Gets the Icon Secondary Stream Name.

Text.ValueDesc: Image parsing name.
The user-friendly form of System.Importance. This value is not intended to be parsed programmatically.
The text (with formatted property values) to show in the infotip.
The name of a .exe or .dll file as stored in a resource section within that file.
Identifies whether the item is an attachment.

Text.DisplayName: Is Default Non Owner Save Location
Text.Summary: Gets the Is Default Non Owner Save Location.
Text.ValueDesc: Identifies the default save location for a library for non-owners of the library.

Text.Summary: Gets the Is Default Save Location.
Text.ValueDesc: Identifies the default save location for a library for the owner of the library.

Text.DisplayName: Is Default Save Location For Display
Text.Summary: Gets the Is Default Save Location For Display.
Text.ValueDesc: Identifies the default save location for a library for the owner of the library.
Identifies whether the item is encrypted.
Identifies whether the message was completely received. This value is used with some error conditions.
Identifies whether a location was indexed (locally or remotely) at the time it was added to the library.

Text.DisplayName: Is Pinned To Name Space Tree
Text.Summary: Gets the Is Pinned To Name Space Tree.
Text.ValueDesc: Identifies whether a shell folder is pinned to the navigation pane.
Identifies whether the item has been read.

Text.Summary: Gets the Is Search Only Item.
Text.ValueDesc: Identifies whether a location or a library is search only.

Text.Summary: Gets the Is Send To Target.
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates whether an item is a valid SendTo target. This information is provided by certain Shell folders.
Indicates whether the item is shared. This checks only the non-inherited ACLs.
Indicates whether the item is shared. This checks only the non-inherited ACLs.
Indicates whether the item is shared. This checks only the non-inherited ACLs.
Class type of the item.

Property.Name: ItemDate

Text.ValueDesc: The primary date of interest for an item.

Property.Text: In the case of photos, for example, this property maps to System.Photo.DateTaken.

Text.ValueDesc: The user-friendly display name of an item's parent folder.
The base name of the System.ItemNameDisplay property.
The display name in "most complete" form.

Text.Summary: Gets the Item Name Display Without Extension.
Text.ValueDesc: This is similar to System.ItemNameDisplay except that it never includes a file extension.
The prefix of an item, used for e-mail messages where the subject begins with the prefix "Re:".

Text.Summary: Gets the Item Name Sort Override.
Text.ValueDesc: This string should be set to the phonetic version of the display name as defined in System.ItemNameDisplay in CJK locales(CHS Pinyin, JPN Hiragana, KOR Hangul, etc.).
The generic list of people associated with and contributing to an item.
The user-friendly display path to the item.

Property.Name: ItemQueryCondition
Property.Win32: Used by: System.ThumbnailStream on .mp3 format file, System.Contact.AccountPictureLarge, System.Contact.AccountPictureSmall

Text.Summary: Gets the Item Search Location Header Type.

Text.ValueDesc: Describes the sub-type of an item.
Represents a well-formed URL that points to the item.
The user-friendly form of System.Kind. This value is not intended to be parsed programmatically.
The primary language of the file, particularly if that file is a document.

Text.Summary: Gets the Last Writer Package Family Name.
Text.ValueDesc: Mark of the app container. The package family name of the last app to edit the file's contents.

Text.Summary: Gets the Library Location Support Status.

Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the number of library locations.
The low confidence keywords for the item.
The medium confidence keywords for the item.

Text.Summary: Gets the Music Stack Thumbnail Cache Ids.

Text.ValueDesc: The CLSID of the name space extension for an item, the object that implements IShellFolder for this item.

Text.Summary: Gets the Network Places Default Name.
Gets the New Menu Allowed Types.
Gets the New Menu Preferred Types.

Text.ValueDesc: SID of the user that owns the library.
Used to get the IBindCtx for an item to be parsed.
The Shell namespace name of an item relative to a parent folder.
The Shell namespace path to the item.
The perceived file type based on its canonical type.
The amount of space filled, as a percentage.
The user-friendly form of System.Priority. This value is not intended to be parsed programmatically.
The user-friendly form of System.Rating. This value is not intended to be parsed programmatically.
SFGAO values as used in IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf.

Property.Name: SearchScope
Property.Win32: Used by: System.ThumbnailStream on .mp3 format file, System.Contact.AccountPictureLarge, System.Contact.AccountPictureSmall

Text.ValueDesc: Indicates who the item is shared with.
Indicates the sharing status of an item: Not Shared, Shared, Everyone (homegroup or everyone), or Private.
The system-provided file system size of the item, in bytes.

Text.Summary: Gets the Source Package Family Name.
Text.ValueDesc: Package family name of the app which the storage item instance originated.

Text.Summary: Gets the Stack Thumbnail Cache Ids.

Text.ValueDesc: Generic status information applicable to the item.

Text.Summary: Gets the Selected item count and size.
Text.ValueDesc: The count of selected items in the view and the estimated total size.

Text.Summary: Gets the Storage Provider Caller Version Information.
Text.ValueDesc: The storage provider caller protocol version information.The format of this property is provider specific, refer to the storage provider documentation for more information.

Text.Summary: Gets the Storage Provider Descendant Sharing Status.
Gets the Storage Provider File Checksum.
Text.ValueDesc: The checksum computed by the storage provider for the file. Files with the same checksum value will have the same contents.

Text.Summary: Gets the Storage Provider File Flags.
Gets the Storage Provider File Identifier.
Text.ValueDesc: The storage provider identifier for this file.

Text.Summary: Gets the Storage Provider File Remote Uri.
Gets the Storage Provider File Version.
Gets the Storage Provider File Version Waterline.
Text.ValueDesc: The storage provider computed file version waterline for this file. This value is used to detect if a file has changed.

Text.Summary: Gets the Storage Provider Fully Qualified Id.

Text.ValueDesc: This property represents the [Storage Provider ID] part of the fully-qualified provider identifier"[Storage Provider ID]![Windows SID]![Account ID]".

Text.Summary: Gets the Storage Provider Network Connected.
Gets the Storage Provider Protection Mode.
Gets the Storage Provider Share Statuses.
Text.ValueDesc: This property represents a list of share statuses for the file/folder specified by the storage provider.Each share status must be one of the known value specified by the enumerations belowStorageProviderShareStatuses is a readonly property, it should only be updated by the storage provider.

Text.Summary: Gets the Storage Provider Thumbnail Dimensions.
Gets the Storage Provider Warning Error State.
Gets the Sync Transfer Status Flags.

Property.Name: Thumbnail
Property.Win32: CLIPDATA format, Used by: System.Thumbnail on .xls format file

Text.ValueDesc: A unique value used as a key to cache thumbnails.

Text.Summary: Gets the Thumbnail Cache Id Parts.

Property.Name: ThumbnailStream
Property.Win32: Used by: System.ThumbnailStream on .mp3 format file, System.Contact.AccountPictureLarge, System.Contact.AccountPictureSmall

Property.Name: TitleSortOverride

Text.ValueDesc: This optional string value allows for overriding the standard sort order of System.

Property.Text: Title.This is very important for proper sorting of music files in Japanese which cannot becorrectly sorted phonetically (the user-expected ordering) without this field.It can also be used for customizing sorting in non-East Asian scenarios,such as allowing the user to remove articles for sorting purposes.

Property.Name: TooltipThumbnailStream
Property.Win32: Used by: System.ThumbnailStream on .mp3 format file, System.Contact.AccountPictureLarge, System.Contact.AccountPictureSmall

Text.ValueDesc: The GUID of the NTFS Volume.
The mark of the web zone, as a URLZONE enumeration value.
The document contributor.

Property.Name: DateCreated

Text.ValueDesc: The date and time that a document was created.

Property.Text: This property is stored in the document, not obtained from the file system.

Text.ValueDesc: The last person to save the document, as stored in the document.
The revision number.

Text.Summary: Access control information, from SummaryInfo propset
Text.ValueDesc: Access control information, from SummaryInfo propset.

Property.Name: DatePrinted

Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the date and time the document was last printed.

Property.Text: The legacy name is "DocLastPrinted".

Property.Name: DateSaved

Text.Summary: Specify last saved date and time
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the date and time the document was last saved.

Property.Text: The legacy name is "DocLastSavedTm".

Text.ValueDesc: This property represents the total time between each open and save, accumulated since the creation of the document. This is measured in 100ns units, not milliseconds. VT_FILETIME for IPropertySetStorage handlers (legacy).
Indicates the audio compression used on the audio file.

Text.Summary: Indicates the average data rate in Hz for the audio file in "bits per second".
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the average data rate in Hertz (Hz) for the audio file in bits per second.

Text.Summary: Indicates the format of the audio file.
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the format of the audio file.

Property.Name: IsVariableBitrate

Text.Summary: Indicates whether Bit Rate of the audio is variable
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates whether the audio file had a variable or constant bit rate.

Property.Text: True if the bit rate of the audio is variable; false if the bit rate is constant; otherwise, null if this value is not specified.

Text.Summary: Indicates the audio sample rate for the audio file in "samples per second".
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the sample rate for the audio file in samples per second.

Text.Summary: Indicates the audio sample size for the audio file in "bits per sample".
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the sample size for the audio file in bits per sample.
Identifies the name of the stream for the audio file.
Identifies the stream number of the audio file.

Text.Summary: Gets the Is Variable Bit Rate.
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates whether the audio file had a variable or constant bit rate.

Text.Summary: Indicates when play expires for digital rights management.
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates when play rights expire.

Text.Summary: Indicates when play starts for digital rights management.
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates when play rights begin.

Text.Summary: Displays the description for digital rights management.
Text.ValueDesc: Displays the description for Digital Rights Management (DRM).

Property.Name: IsProtected

Text.Summary: Indicates whether the content is protected
Text.ValueDesc: true if the content of the file is protected; false if the file content is unprotected; otherwise, null if this value is not specified.

Property.Text: Indicates whether the file is protected under Digital Rights Management (DRM).

Text.Summary: Indicates the play count for digital rights management.
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the number of times the file has been played.
Indicates whether the media file has been disabled by DRM.

Text.Summary: The name of the GPS area
Text.ValueDesc: The name of the GPS area.
This is the value at index 0 from an array of three values.
This is the value at index 1 from an array of three values.
This is the value at index 2 from an array of three values.

Text.Summary: Indicates whether latitude is north or south latitude
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates whether latitude is north or south.
This is the value at index 0 from an array of three values.
This is the value at index 1 from an array of three values.
This is the value at index 2 from an array of three values.

Text.Summary: Indicates whether longitude is east or west longitude
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates whether longitude is east or west.
eg: 2-dimensional, 3-dimensional Indicates the GPS measurement mode (for example, two-dimensional, three-dimensional).

Text.Summary: Indicates the name of the method used for location finding
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the name of the method used for finding locations.

Text.Summary: Indicates the version of the GPS information
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the version of the GPS information.
Indicates altitude based on the reference in PKEY_GPS_AltitudeRef.
The denominator of PKEY_GPS_Altitude.
The numerator of PKEY_GPS_Altitude.
Indicates the reference for the altitude property (for example, above sea level, below sea level, absolute value).
Indicates the GPS DOP (data degree of precision). Calculated from PKEY_GPS_DOPNumerator and PKEY_GPS_DOPDenominator.
The denominator of PKEY_GPS_DOP.
The numerator of PKEY_GPS_DOP.
The date and time of the GPS record.
Indicates the bearing to the destination point. Calculated from PKEY_GPS_DestBearingNumerator and PKEY_GPS_DestBearingDenominator.
The denominator of PKEY_GPS_DestBearing.
The numerator of PKEY_GPS_DestBearing.
Indicates the reference used for giving the bearing to the destination point (for example,true direction, magnetic direction).
Indicates the distance to the destination point.
The denominator of PKEY_GPS_DestDistance.
The numerator of PKEY_GPS_DestDistance.
Indicates the unit used to express the distance to the destination (for example, kilometers, miles, knots).
Learn how the System.GPS.DestLatitude property indicates the latitude of the destination point.
The denominator of PKEY_GPS_DestLatitude.
The numerator of PKEY_GPS_DestLatitude.
Indicates whether the latitude destination point is north or south latitude.
Learn how the System.GPS.DestLongitude property indicates the longitude of the destination point.
The denominator of PKEY_GPS_DestLongitude.
The numerator of PKEY_GPS_DestLongitude.
Indicates whether the longitude destination point is east or west longitude.
Indicates whether differential correction was applied to the GPS receiver.
Indicates the direction of the image when it was captured. Calculated from PKEY_GPS_ImgDirectionNumerator and PKEY_GPS_ImgDirectionDenominator.
The denominator of PKEY_GPS_Img Direction.
The numerator of PKEY_GPS_Img Direction.
Indicates reference for giving the direction of the image when it was captured, (for example, true direction, magnetic direction).
Indicates the latitude based on the reference in PKEY_GPS_LatitudeRef. Calculated from PKEY_GPS_LatitudeNumerator and PKEY_GPS_LatitudeDenominator.
The denominator of PKEY_GPS_Latitude.
The numerator of PKEY_GPS_Latitude.
Indicates the longitude.
Indicates the longitude based on the reference in PKEY_GPS_LongitudeRef. Calculated from PKEY_GPS_LongitudeNumerator and PKEY_GPS_LongitudeDenominator.
The denominator of PKEY_GPS_Longitude.
The numerator of PKEY_GPS_Longitude.
Indicates the geodetic survey data used by the GPS receiver.
Indicates the GPS satellites used for measurements.
Indicates the speed of the GPS receiver movement.
The denominator of PKEY_GPS_Speed.
The numerator of PKEY_GPS_Speed.
Indicates the unit used to express the speed of the GPS receiver movement, (for example,kilometers per hour, miles per hour, knots).
Indicates the status of the GPS receiver when the image was recorded (for example, measurement in progress, measurement interoperability).
Indicates the direction of the GPS receiver movement.
The denominator of PKEY_GPS_Track.
The numerator of PKEY_GPS_Track.
Indicates reference for the direction of the GPS receiver movement (for example, true direction, magnetic direction).

Property.Name: BitDepth

Text.ValueDesc: Indicates how many bits are used in each pixel of the image.

Property.Text: (Usually 8, 16, 24, or 32).

Property.Name: ColorSpace

Text.ValueDesc: PropertyTagExifColorSpace The colorspace embedded in the image.

Property.Text: Taken from the Exchangeable Image File (EXIF) information.

Property.Name: CompressedBitsPerPixel

Text.ValueDesc: Calculated from PKEY_Image_CompressedBitsPerPixelNumerator and PKEY_Image_CompressedBitsPerPixelDenominator.

Property.Text: Indicates the image compression level.

Text.ValueDesc: PropertyTagCompression The algorithm used to compress the image.

Property.Name: CompressionText

Text.Summary: This is the user-friendly form of System.Image.Compression.
Text.ValueDesc: Not intended to be parsed programmatically.

Property.Text: The user-friendly form of System.Image.Compression. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.

Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the number of pixels per resolution unit in the image width.
The horizontal size of the image, in pixels.

Property.Name: ResolutionUnit

Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the resolution units.

Property.Text: Used for images with a non-square aspect ratio, but without meaningful absolute dimensions. 1 = No absolute unit of measurement. 2 = Inches. 3 = Centimeters. The default value is 2 (Inches).

Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the number of pixels per resolution unit in the image height.
The vertical size of the image, in pixels.

Text.Summary: Gets the Compressed Bits Per Pixel Denominator.
Text.ValueDesc: The denominator of PKEY_Image_CompressedBitsPerPixel.

Text.Summary: Gets the Compressed Bits Per Pixel Numerator.
Text.ValueDesc: The numerator of PKEY_Image_CompressedBitsPerPixel.
The numerator of PKEY_Image_CompressedBitsPerPixel.

Property.Name: Dimensions

Text.ValueDesc: The image dimensions in string format as horizontal pixels x vertical pixels.

Property.Text: For example, 3080x2100.

Text.ValueDesc: The image dimensions in string format as horizontal pixels x vertical pixels. For example, 3080x2100.
100ns units, not milliseconds The actual play time of a media file and is measured in 100ns units, not milliseconds.

Text.Summary: Indicates the frame count for the image.
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the frame count for the image.
If media is protected, how is it protected? Describes the type of media protection.
Rating value ranges from 0 to 99, supplied by metadata provider The rating (0 - 99) supplied by metadata provider.
Supplied by metadata provider The style of music or video, supplied by metadata provider.

Text.Summary: Gets the Media class primary ID.
Gets the Media class secondary ID.

Text.ValueDesc: The date and time the file was encoded. The DateTime is in UTC (in the doc, not file system).
The DLNA profile ID for media content, defined by DLNA standards.
A 1 based monotonically incremented number that corresponds to the episode of the show.
A 1 based monotonically incremented number that corresponds to the season that the show was first presented.
A name that represents a specific series, such as a podcast or recorded television series.
The System.Media.ThumbnailLargePath property contains the filesystem path to the large thumbnail representation of the media item.
The URI of the large thumbnail representation of the media item.
The System.Media.ThumbnailSmallPath property contains the filesystem path to the small thumbnail representation of the media item.
The URI of the small thumbnail representation of the media item.
If true, do not alter this file's metadata. Set by user.
Indicates the channel count for the audio file. Possible values are 1 for mono and 2 for stereo.

Property.Name: DisplayArtist

Text.Summary: Gets the Album Artist (best match of relevant properties).
Text.ValueDesc: The best representation of Album Artist for a given music file based upon AlbumArtist, ContributingArtist and compilation info.

Property.Text: This property returns the best representation of the album artist for a specific music file based upon System.Music.AlbumArtist, System.Music.Artist, and System.Music.IsCompilation information.

Property.Name: AlbumArtistSortOverride

Text.ValueDesc: This optional string value allows for overriding the standard sort order of System.

Property.Text: Music.AlbumArtist.This is very important for proper sorting of music files in Japanese which cannot becorrectly sorted phonetically (the user-expected ordering) without this field.It can also be used for customizing sorting in non-East Asian scenarios,such as allowing the user to remove articles for sorting purposes.

Text.ValueDesc: This property differentiates albums with the same title from different artists. It is the concatenation of System.Music.AlbumArtist and System.Music.AlbumTitle.

Property.Name: AlbumTitleSortOverride

Text.ValueDesc: This optional string value allows for overriding the standard sort order of System.

Property.Text: Music.Album.This is very important for proper sorting of music files in Japanese which cannot becorrectly sorted phonetically (the user-expected ordering) without this field.It can also be used for customizing sorting in non-East Asian scenarios,such as allowing the user to remove articles for sorting purposes.

Property.Name: ArtistSortOverride

Text.ValueDesc: This optional string value allows for overriding the standard sort order of System.

Property.Text: Music.Artist.This is very important for proper sorting of music files in Japanese which cannot becorrectly sorted phonetically (the user-expected ordering) without this field.It can also be used for customizing sorting in non-East Asian scenarios,such as allowing the user to remove articles for sorting purposes.

Property.Name: ComposerSortOverride

Text.ValueDesc: This optional string value allows for overriding the standard sort order of System.

Property.Text: Music.Composer.This is very important for proper sorting of music files in Japanese which cannot becorrectly sorted phonetically (the user-expected ordering) without this field.It can also be used for customizing sorting in non-East Asian scenarios,such as allowing the user to remove articles for sorting purposes.

Text.Summary: Specify the disc number of a track
Gets the Part of a compilation.
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates whether the music file is part of a compilation.

Text.Summary: Specify the mood of the track

Text.ValueDesc: The manufacturer name of the camera that took the photo, in a string format.
The model name of the camera that shot the photo, in string form.
The date when the photo was taken, as read from the camera in the file's Exchangeable Image File (EXIF) tag.

Property.Name: Event

Text.Summary: Return the event at which the photo was taken
Text.ValueDesc: The event where the photo was taken.

Property.Text: The end-user provides this value.

Text.ValueDesc: The Exchangeable Image File (EXIF) version.
The orientation of the photo when it was taken, as specified in the Exchangeable Image File (EXIF) information and in terms of rows and columns.

Property.Name: OrientationText

Text.ValueDesc: The user-friendly form of System.

Property.Text: Photo.Orientation. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.

Text.Summary: The people tags on an image.
Text.ValueDesc: The people tags on an image.
The aperture value of the image, in APEX units.
The denominator of System.Photo.Aperture.
The numerator of System.Photo.Aperture.
The brightness value of the image, in APEX units, usually in the range of -99.99 to 99.99.
The denominator of PKEY_Photo_Brightness.
The numerator of PKEY_Photo_Brightness.
The serial number of the camera that produced the photo.
Indicates the direction of contrast processing applied by the camera when the image was taken. "0" indicates "Normal"; "1" indicates "Soft"; "2" indicates "Hard".
The user-friendly form of System.Photo.Contrast. It is not intended to be parsed programmatically.
The digital zoom ratio when the image was shot.
The denominator of PKEY_Photo_DigitalZoom.
The numerator of PKEY_Photo_DigitalZoom.
The amount of exposure bias used in the photo, as read from the camera.
The denominator of PKEY_Photo_ExposureBias.
The numerator of PKEY_Photo_ExposureBias.
Indicates the exposure index selected on the camera or input device at the time the photo was taken. Calculated from PKEY_Photo_ExposureIndexNumerator and PKEY_Photo_ExposureIndexDenominator.
The denominator of PKEY_Photo_ExposureIndex.
The numerator of PKEY_Photo_ExposureIndex.
The Exposure Program mode of the camera at the time the photo was taken, as read from the Exchangeable Image File (EXIF) information.
The user-friendly form of System.Photo.ExposureProgram. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
The exposure time for the photo, in seconds, as read from the Exchangeable Image File (EXIF) information.
The denominator of PKEY_Photo_ExposureTime.
The numerator of PKEY_Photo_ExposureTime.
The FNumber value when the photo was taken, as read from the Exchangeable Image File (EXIF) information.
The denominator of PKEY_Photo_FNumber.
The numerator of PKEY_Photo_FNumber.
An indicator of the flash status when the photo was taken, as read from the Exchangeable Image File (EXIF) info.
Indicates the strobe energy at the time the image was captured, measured in Beam Candle Power Seconds. Calculated from PKEY_Photo_FlashEnergyNumerator and PKEY_Photo_FlashEnergyDenominator.
The denominator of PKEY_Photo_FlashEnergy.
The numerator of PKEY_Photo_FlashEnergy.
The numerator of PKEY_Photo_FlashEnergy.
A string indicating the manufacturer of the flash used to take the picture. Can be blank or not present.
String indicating the model of the flash used to take the picture. Can be blank or not present.
The user-friendly form of System.Photo.Flash. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
The focal length of the lens as recorded by the camera when the photo was taken, measured in millimeters.
The denominator of PKEY_Photo_FocalLength.
The focal length of the lens when the photo was taken, as converted to a 35mm film measurement.
The numerator of PKEY_Photo_FocalLength.

Text.Summary: Gets the Focal plane X resolution.
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the number of pixels in the image width (X direction) per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit on the camera focal plane. Calculated from PKEY_Photo_FocalPlaneXResolutionNumerator and PKEY_Photo_FocalPlaneXResolutionDenominator.

Text.Summary: Gets the Focal Plane XResolution Denominator.
Text.ValueDesc: The denominator of PKEY_Photo_FocalPlaneXResolution.

Text.Summary: Gets the Focal Plane XResolution Numerator.
Text.ValueDesc: The numerator of PKEY_Photo_FocalPlaneXResolution.

Text.Summary: Gets the Focal plane Y resolution.
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the number of pixels in the image height (Y direction) per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit on the camera focal plane. Calculated from PKEY_Photo_FocalPlaneYResolutionNumerator and PKEY_Photo_FocalPlaneYResolutionDenominator.

Text.Summary: Gets the Focal Plane YResolution Denominator.
Text.ValueDesc: The denominator of PKEY_Photo_FocalPlaneYResolution.

Text.Summary: Gets the Focal Plane YResolution Numerator.
Text.ValueDesc: The numerator of PKEY_Photo_FocalPlaneYResolution.
Indicates the degree of overall image gain adjustment. Calculated from PKEY_Photo_GainControlNumerator and PKEY_Photo_GainControlDenominator.
The denominator of PKEY_Photo_GainControl.
The numerator of PKEY_Photo_GainControl.
The user-friendly form of System.Photo.GainControl. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
The International Standards Organization (ISO) speed as recorded by the camera when the photo was taken.
String indicating the manufacturer of the lens used to take the picture. Can be blank or not present.
A string indicating the model of the lens used to take the picture. Can be blank or not present.
The light source when the photo was taken, as read from the Exchangeable Image File (EXIF) information.
The Exchangeable Image File (EXIF) extensibility mechanism that allows camera manufacturers to provide custom information.
The offset for the maker note specified in System.Photo.MakerNote.
The maximum aperture of the lens as recorded by the camera, taken from the Exchangeable Image File (EXIF) information.
The denominator of PKEY_Photo_MaxAperture.
The numerator of PKEY_Photo_MaxAperture.
The metering mode used by the camera, taken from the Exchangeable Image File (EXIF) information.
The user-friendly form of System.Photo.MeteringMode. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
The pixel composition.
The user-friendly form of System.Photo.PhotometricInterpretation.
The class of the program used by the camera to set exposure.
The user-friendly form of System.Photo.ProgramMode. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
The file name of a sound annotation file associated with the photo.
Indicates the direction of saturation processing applied by the camera when the photo was taken.
The user-friendly form of System.Photo.Saturation. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
Indicates the direction of sharpness processing applied by the camera when the photo was taken.
The user-friendly form of System.Photo.Sharpness. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
The shutter speed of the camera when the photo was taken. This is given in APEX units.
The denominator of PKEY_Photo_ShutterSpeed.
The numerator of PKEY_Photo_ShutterSpeed.
The distance to the subject in meters. Calculated from PKEY_Photo_SubjectDistanceNumerator and PKEY_Photo_SubjectDistanceDenominator.
The denominator of PKEY_Photo_SubjectDistance.
The numerator of PKEY_Photo_SubjectDistance.
A read-only aggregation of tag-like properties for use in building views.
A VT_BOOL that indicates whether the image has been transcoded for synchronizing with an external device.
The white balance mode at the time the photo was shot, as taken from the Exchangeable Image File (EXIF) information.
The user-friendly form of System.Photo.WhiteBalance. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.

Property.Name: ChannelNumber

Text.ValueDesc: Example: 42 The recorded TV channels.

Property.Text: For example, 42, 5, 53.

Property.Name: EpisodeName

Text.ValueDesc: Example: "Nowhere to Hyde" The names of recorded TV episodes.

Property.Text: For example, "Nowhere to Hyde".

Text.Summary: Indicates whether the video is DTV
Indicates whether the video is HDTV

Property.Name: StationCallSign

Text.ValueDesc: Example: "TOONP" Any recorded station call signs.

Property.Text: For example, "TOONP".

Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the credits for the program, in the following format. "Actor1/Actor2/Actor3...;Director1/Director2/Director3...;Host1/Host2/Host3...;GuestStar".

Text.Summary: Gets the Number of times used.
Indicates the level of compression for the video stream.
Text.ValueDesc: Specifies the video compression format.
Indicates the person who directed the video.

Property.Name: EncodingBitrate

Text.Summary: Indicates the data rate in "bits per second" for the video stream.
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the data rate in "bits per second" for the video stream.

Property.Text: "DataRate".

Text.Summary: Indicates the frame height for the video stream.
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the frame height for the video stream.

Text.Summary: Indicates the frame rate in "frames per millisecond" for the video stream.
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the frame rate for the video stream, in frames per 1000 seconds.

Text.Summary: Indicates the frame width for the video stream.
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the frame width for the video stream.

Property.Name: HorizontalAspectRatio

Text.Summary: Indicates the horizontal portion of the aspect ratio.
Text.ValueDesc: The X portion of XX:YY, like 16:9.

Property.Text: Indicates the horizontal portion of the pixel aspect ratio. The X portion of XX:YY. For example, 10 is the X portion of 10:11.

Property.Name: StreamName

Text.Summary: Indicates the name for the video stream.
Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the name for the video stream.

Property.Text: "StreamName".

Text.ValueDesc: Indicates the ordinal number of the stream being played.

Property.Name: VerticalAspectRatio

Text.Summary: Indicates the vertical portion of the aspect ratio
Text.ValueDesc: The Y portion of XX:YY, like 16:9.

Property.Text: Indicates the horizontal portion of the pixel aspect ratio. The Y portion of XX:YY. For example, 11 is the Y portion of 10:11 .

Text.ValueDesc: Specifies the FOURCC code for the video stream.
Indicates whether the media file has a spherical video stream.
This is the video orientation in degrees.
Indicates the sample size in bits for the video stream. "SampleSize".
Indicates the total data rate in "bits per second" for all video and audio streams.
Indicates the vertical portion of the aspect ratio.
Indicates the vertical portion of the aspect ratio.

Contains the identifiers of the albums that the item is a member of. Can be used in conjunction with the Album item in the Content Indexer APIs to notify other apps about picture albums either the user created or apps have already created.
